Certainly, here is a potential technical requirements document (TRD) for the fortune teller app:

Overview
--------

The fortune teller app is a web-based application that uses a random number generator to predict users' futures. The app will provide personalized fortunes based on the user's name and will offer a variety of different predictions in areas such as love, success, and happiness.

Technical Requirements
----------------------

* The app will be built using the Ruby on Rails framework.
* The app will use a PostgreSQL database to store user data and fortunes.
* The app will be deployed on a cloud-based hosting provider, such as AWS or Heroku.
* The app will be tested using a combination of manual and automated testing methods.

System Architecture
-------------------

The fortune teller app will be a web-based application that runs on a server and is accessed by users through their web browsers. The app will be built using the Ruby on Rails framework and will use a PostgreSQL database to store user data and fortunes. The app will be deployed on a cloud-based hosting provider, such as AWS or Heroku, and will be accessible to users 24/7.

Technical Components
--------------------

* Ruby on Rails: The app will be built using the Ruby on Rails framework, which provides a robust and reliable foundation for web-based applications.
* PostgreSQL: The app will use a PostgreSQL database to store user data and fortunes. This will provide a scalable and flexible solution for managing the app's data.
* Cloud hosting: The app will be deployed on a cloud-based hosting provider, such as AWS or Heroku. This will ensure that the app is always available to users and can handle a large number of users without downtime.
* Testing: The app will be tested using a combination of manual and automated testing methods. This will ensure that the app is stable and reliable, and will help identify and fix any bugs or issues.

Security
--------

* User authentication: The app will use secure user authentication to protect user data and ensure that only authorized users can access the app.
* Data encryption: The app will encrypt sensitive user data, such as passwords and personal information, to prevent unauthorized access.
* Regular updates: The app will be regularly updated to address any security vulnerabilities or bugs that are discovered.

Performance
-----------

* Scalability: The app will be designed to handle a large number of users without degradation in performance.
* Load balancing: The app will use load balancing to distribute traffic across multiple servers and ensure that the app remains responsive even under heavy load.
* Monitoring: The app will be monitored to identify and address any performance issues that may arise.

Maintenance and Support
-----------------------

* Regular updates: The app will be regularly updated to address any bugs or issues that are discovered.
* User support: The app will provide user support through a knowledge base and email or chat support for any questions or issues that users may have.
* Data backups: The app will regularly back up user data to prevent data loss in the event of a disaster or other unforeseen event.
